intro: Tyleria linearis, commonly known as the slender Tyleria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in dense inflorescences, and it produces edible fruits that are consumed by local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tyleria linearis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
